section.title: Source Files
section.para: This window is displayed automatically when OmegaT loads a project, and at any time by using .
The window displays the following information:

listitem.para: in the window title: the total number of translatable files in the project.
These are the files present in the folder in a format that OmegaT is able to recognize.
as a list: all the translatable files in the project.
Clicking on any file will open it in the for translation.
File entries include their names, file filter types, their encoding and the number of segments each file contains
The total number of segments, the number of unique segments in the whole project, and the number of unique segments already translated are shown at the bottom.

section.para: Typing any text will open a Filter field at the bottom of the window where parts of filenames can be entered. You can use arrows to select a file, and open it for translation by pressing Enter.

note.para: Filenames (in the first column) can be sorted alphabetically by clicking in the header. It is also possible to change the position of a filename, by clicking on it and pressing the Move ... button on the right.

section.para: Right-clicking on a filename opens a popup that allows opening the source file and (if it exists) the target file.
The number of Unique segments is calculated by removing the number of duplicate segments from the total segment number.
The difference between "Number of segments" and "Number of unique segments" provides an approximate idea of the number of repetitions in the text. The item in the menu will give you more information.
Modifying the segmentation rules may alter the number of segments/unique segments. This, however, should generally be avoided once you have started translating the project. See for details.

The buttons at the bottom can be used to add files to your project:
Add Files...
Copies the selected files to the folder and reloads the project to take the new files into account.
Add Online MediaWiki Page...
Asks for the page URL and downloads it into the folder.
The two actions are equivalent to using the menu commands and .

note.para: To keep the Source Files list window to automatically open when a project is loaded, manually change project_files_show_on_load to false in the configuration file.
